title: Kate and Rio Ferdinand's Turkish wedding: Ex-TOWIE star shares photos
text:
Kate and Rio Ferdinand shared further insight into their extravagant Turkish wedding on Instagram on Monday.

The newlyweds tied the knot in front of family, friends and former TOWIE stars Lydia and Debbie Bright at the end of last month.

Reminiscing on their pre-wedding brunch, Kate, 28, shared a slew of snaps from the celebrations, while Rio, 40, posted an amusing video of himself doing his best Salt Bae impression with the viral star.

Newlyweds: Kate and Rio Ferdinand shared further insight into their extravagant Turkish wedding on Instagram on Monday

The couple were the picture of bliss in a series of snaps from the brunch, which was held at 'Salt Bae's' steakhouse Nusr-Et ahead of the nuptials.

Declaring her love for her new husband, Kate shared a trio of photos of themselves sharing a 'private joke' while a saxophonist played in the background.

In keeping with the bridal theme, the reality star looked stunning in a strapless white dress which showed off her gym-honed figure.

Hilarious: Rio, 40, shared an amusing video of himself doing his best Salt Bae impression with the viral star

Giggling: Declaring her love for her new husband, Kate shared a trio of photos of them sharing a 'private joke' while a saxophonist played in the background

Marital bliss: The couple tied the knot in front of family, friends and former TOWIE stars Lydia and Debbie Bright at the end of last month

Party: Reminiscing on their pre-wedding brunch, Kate, 28, shared a slew of snaps from the celebrations (posing here with Salt Bae)

In a separate post, the bride posed with the wedding party- including Lydia Bright's mum Debbie, Salt Bae and Rio's daughter Tia, eight.

Kate captioned the post: 'Reminiscing on the best brunch with our family & friends.'

Nusr-Et steakhouse is owned by Turkish chef Nusret Gökçe, known by his Internet-given moniker, who found fame in 2017 when a video went viral showing him cutting a steak and adding salt.

And Rio couldn't resist giving it a go. Sharing the moment on Instagram, the sports pundit sprinkled salt over the juicy steak before Nusret picked up the meat for him to taste.

Royalty: He also shared a photo of himself, Kate and Tia and captioned it: 'My queen and my princess'

Special moment: The happy couple shared a hug with Rio's son Tate

The whole crew: Rio also shared a snap with his extended family

Delicious: The couple were the picture of bliss in a series of snaps from the brunch, which was held at 'Salt Bae's' steakhouse Nusr-Et ahead of the nuptials

Close bond: In a separate post, the bride cuddled Rio's daughter Tia, eight, while posing with her friend Melissa (L)

Three generations: The former TOWIE star's grandma and mum Mary flew out to Turkey for the celebrations

Meaty: It seemed Debbie was particularly impressed by Salt Bae's skills, as she shared a video of Salt Bae at work and wrote: 'Genius. Never tasted meat like it'

The former footballer player wrote: 'Pre wedding brunch @nusr_et handing out the fine steak.'

He also shared a photo of himself, Kate and Tia and captioned it: 'My queen and my princess'.

Since their lavish nuptials Kate has made their marriage Instagram official and has changed her surname from Wright to Ferdinand on the photo-sharing site.

Celebrations: Rio's family were also part of the wedding party

Coveted invite: Umar Kamani, founder of PrettyLittleThing, was invited to the three day celebrations

Kate revealed to OK! that their nuptials didn't come without some major stress, as she was tasked with finding a new wedding dress with just one week to spare.

She explained: 'I had been having a dress made since January but it all went wrong and it just wasn’t made right. A week before we flew to Turkey, I still didn’t have a dress. it was a total nightmare and I was stressed!'

The newlywed beauty added: 'I had to have an entire new dress made by The Wedding Club and fitted within a week. In the end I adored my dress and preferred it to the original. Some things are meant to be.'

And when things finally did come together on the day, football pundit Rio admitted the tears flowed as he watched his daughter Tia, eight, served as Kate's maid of honour, while his sons Lorenz, 13, and Tate, 11, walked her halfway down the aisle.

Rio was previously married to Rebecca Ellison, who sadly passed away from breast cancer on 2 May 2015, aged 34.

The retired footballer popped the question to Kate in front of his three children during a family holiday to Dubai in November last year, after nearly two years of dating.
